description: Amiternum was an ancient settlement of the Sabines that Rome captured in 293 BC. The settlement was situated at the intersection of four Roman roads: the Via Caecilia, the Via Claudia Nova, and the two branches of the Via Salaria. The historian Sallust was born at Amiternum in 86 B.C.
details:
The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: S. Vittorino

This site is not to be confused with the similarly named Amiternum located in Samnium.

names.description: "AMITERNUM, a town of the Sabines, in Italy, now extinct. The ruins are to be seen on the level ridge of a mountain near S. Vittorino and the springs of the Aternus; not far from Aquila, which rose out of the ruins of Amiternum." (Seally, 1787, Vol. 1, entry Amiternum)
